channel.title: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided
channel.description: I tried making Summoning levels affect your Combat level and I've added it server-sided. But now I want to make it so it shows the correct combat level on the Combat Tab. I figure it has something to do with client.java, anyone have any ideas?

item.title: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided
item.dc:creator: @CombustionXOwner CombustionXOwner
item.description:
@CombustionXOwner wrote:

Like for example, if say your combat was 120 without summoning and 132 with summoning. The combat tab would show 120.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided

item.title: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided

@imsuperman05 wrote:

combat level for my DSPk+ like erased pkz, is client.java, regular sources like PI with nothing, prob what vain said.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided
item.dc:creator: @CombustionXOwner CombustionXOwner
item.description:
@CombustionXOwner wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]It would be server sided.

The combat level is streamed to the client,[/quote]

I already have the correct combat level in the server-side, its just the combat level in the Attack Option tab wont change.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided

item.title: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided
item.dc:creator: @CombustionXOwner CombustionXOwner
item.description:
@CombustionXOwner wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=500668.msg3661943#msg3661943 date=1310408050]
replace this with your combat level method in client.java

public int getCombatLevel() { int mag = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5); int ran = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5); int attstr = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]))); if (ran > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[22])) * 0.125)); } else if (mag > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[22])) * 0.125)); } else { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[22])) * 0.125)); } return combatLevel; }

and this with your highandlow method

[code]public void HighAndLow(){
if (combatLevel < 15){
int Low = 3;
int High = combatLevel + 12;
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 15 && combatLevel < 114){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = combatLevel + 12;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 114){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = 126;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
					}[/code]

that should do the trick… i think, hope this is what ur asking for…
[/quote]This should be in Player class, Client class, or PlayerAssistant class, depending on the base server. (Many Project Insanitys vary.)[/quote]

Is this client sided or server sided because this I can’t find those methods in any of those files.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Summoning Affecting Combat Level Client Sided

public int getCombatLevel() { int mag = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5); int ran = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5); int attstr = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]))); if (ran > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[22])) * 0.125)); } else if (mag > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[22])) * 0.125)); } else { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[22])) * 0.125)); } return combatLevel; }

and this with your highandlow method

[code]public void HighAndLow(){
if (combatLevel < 15){
int Low = 3;
int High = combatLevel + 12;
getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 15 && combatLevel < 114){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = combatLevel + 12;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
if (combatLevel > 114){
		int Low = combatLevel - 12;
		int High = 126;
			getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@"+Low+"@yel@ - @red@"+High+"", 199);

					}
					}[/code]

that should do the trick… i think, hope this is what ur asking for…[/quote]

Lol thanks but there is no Combatlevel int or Highandlow in my client.java file =s. Any other possible ideas?
